intro: Platea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan platea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea and nearby islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four or five petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Platea papuana is often found in shaded, humid environments and is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
